Below are the step-by-step breakdown:
Determine \(f(0)\) using the appropriate formula from the function definition.
Since \(0 \leq 1\), use the formula \(f(n) = n - 1\).
Calculate \(f(0)\) by substituting \(n = 0\) into the formula \(f(n) = n - 1\).
Determine \(f(1)\) using the appropriate formula from the function definition.
Since \(1 \leq 1\), use the formula \(f(n) = n - 1\).
Calculate \(f(1)\) by substituting \(n = 1\) into the formula \(f(n) = n - 1\).
Determine \(f(2)\) using the appropriate formula from the function definition.
Since \(2 > 1\), use the formula \(f(n) = n^3 + 2n - 1\).
Calculate \(f(2)\) by substituting \(n = 2\) into the formula \(f(n) = n^3 + 2n - 1\).
Finally, add the values of \(f(0)\), \(f(1)\), and \(f(2)\) to get the result.
